title: Biden Economics Team’s Views, in Their Own Words
sub_head: President-elect’s picks for top economic-policy jobs have focused on inequality, education and climate
body:
WASHINGTON—President-elect Joe Biden is introducing his economic-policy team this week, drawing on veterans of the Obama administration and progressive think tanks. Their past views on inequality, labor economics, education and budget deficits offer a guide to how they could shape the administration’s policies.
Cecilia Rouse, Mr. Biden’s nominee for chairwoman of the Council of Economic Advisers, is a Princeton University economist who leads the university’s public-policy school. She has focused her career on...
